TopicTitle: Grey Goo Mod? (Billions of nano bots working together like in the game Grey Goo)

Articles.Content:
This is just a request for a mod that i think would be fun to have in KSP as well as this being my first EVER thread iv made on KSP,

i took interest in this when i saw the lore for the Goo of the game Grey Goo

(hear -->

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cdaMsAvzkI8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 ),
so the goo was sent in to space to explore, who thinks it would be interesting to have a blob of billions of nanobots? witch you could then leave on a planet E.G EVE, and control it like a rover.

this is just a idea/request ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-23T15:54:11Z" title="02/23/2015 03:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 23, 2015</time> by StarDrive85**

Not a bad idea but I'd imagine you'd need a very powerful computer to load in separate entities if there were to behave like actual nanobots and I doubt most machines could take it. Then again it could be set as one entity but they wouldn't work together as much.

> 
> Not a bad idea but I'd imagine you'd need a very powerful computer to load in separate entities if there were to behave like actual nanobots and I doubt most machines could take it. Then again it could be set as one entity but they wouldn't work together as much.

i was thinking of it just being 1 entity as well that would just look like a blob, but would move and behave as if it was made of billions of nanites.
I think it would be good if someone made it so separate blobs could say join together to make a bigger blob

> 
> I think it would be good if someone made it so separate blobs could say join together to make a bigger blob

ok, that would be awesome.

Sooo, like the stuff we have in the mystery goo canisters?

I am not even sure what we can do with a bunch of goo floating in space with no method of propulsion or containment. Probably they will be ripped apart by tidal forces and form a nano-thin ring around a body?
The idea reminds me of the Michael Crichton book [Prey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prey_%28novel%29).

I have no idea whats inside those canisters ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif), but i was thinking of the mod being made so you have to send like a sphere/box to a planet and then open it, that would realise the goo that could then expand

You haven't given any gameplay details. What would you do with this blob?

I open a container, it creates a blob, now I can move it around.. then what? If I right-click it, what menu items should show up?

Would be interresting to let the goo transform into rocket engines and stuff like that. It transforms itself into a lander and lands on a moon, then nanoparticles harvest whatever matter they can find there and transform it into fuel or more Nano particles. Would have to come up with a lot more interresting things like that to make it interresting in KSP.

Nanobot rocket? Now that would be cool. In a pinch it can just eject parts of itself as reaction mass to fly, and it can convert minerals or whatever it needs to replenish its mass through replication. Making it an amazing space craft. Wonder how they fare against radiation though.
one thing the goo could do is form itself into parts if there is enough goo, ie if you have a blob on the surface of a planet, you can upload a rover design and the goo will form that rover.

take Porkjet's idea for example, you right click and get the options to turn the goo in to parts N stuff, as well as there are other ideas people posted... so yeah

> 
> Anyways, this grey goo stuff is a cool idea, if anyone does decide to make the concept practical, it could become incredibly popular.

I don't see why it would. It sound like a "one solution for everything" type of mod and those remove most of the challenge. Some player may like it but other would not.

It would be interesting to code a moving goo thingy but then what ? As other said it needs to bring something to the gameplay.

I dont think a mod nessesarily needs to adapt to gameplay and balancing, it makes sense for part packs and vanilla-expansion kind of things of course, but you can also make something comepletely different that throws anything else completely overboard. if it grants you a couple of hours of fun, anything goes. Doesn't matter if its cheaty or uncomparable to other parts of the game. That's where I see this idea going, use KSP as a platform for some new/fun/crazy idea. let it have its very own gameplay, E.G. you start with a small ball of goo on Eeloo and have to find rare resources to replicate, grow, transform, and this way travel across the kerbol system to fullfil some goal, could be as simple as visiting/collecting resources from all planet and moons in the game. That wouldn't take very long due to the probably 'cheaty' nature compared to stock stuff. It'd be a fun little chellange. But to come back to the quote, I agree in that it probably wouldnt be extremely popular, more of an obscure niche thing. But it sounds fun, I'd like to play that!

You can't break it. I reckon it would make a great rover. 

Probably wouldn't be very fast though.
